Subject: Colin: Phased Searching Question
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=54567749
X-Yahoo-Profile: kenstanley01


Colin, my office mate and I were discussing phased vs. blended
searching and we were looking at your graphs from your phased writeup
and we realized something about the "Mean Complexity Comparison" is
confusing:

How many generations pass in 30-50 seconds (the approximate period of
each oscillation)?  It looks like not enough could be happening in
that time to warrant a phase switch.  Does fitness really stagnate in
just 20 or 30 seconds?  We thought maybe you'd expect to see the first
phase of the run stay in the complexifying mode for a long time before
going to pruning, since it doesn't usually stagnate right off the
bat?  

I guess the overall question is what is really going on and how is
that graph staying so stable?  Maybe it would be useful to see a graph
of *champion* complexity over time, rather than mean.  Then you might
see where pruning was really paying off.

ken
